intro: Dysemone integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf dysemone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
